item.title: National Guard and Reservists Financial Relief Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 426.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text: National Guard and Reservists Financial Relief Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to make permanent the exemption from tax penalties for premature distributions from retirement plans by members of the National Guard or Ready Reserve called to active duty.

bill.title: National Guard and Reservists Financial Relief Act

item.title: National Guard and Reservists Financial Relief Act
National Guard and Reservists Financial Relief Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently allow penalty-free withdrawals from retirement plans for individuals called to active duty for at least 179 days.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 426.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
